repo.name: seaweedfs
repo.description: SeaweedFS is a fast distributed storage system for blobs, objects, files, and data lake, for billions of files! Blob store has O(1) disk seek, cloud tiering. Filer supports Cloud Drive, xDC replication, Kubernetes, POSIX FUSE mount, S3 API, S3 Gateway, Hadoop, WebDAV, encryption, Erasure Coding. Enterprise version is at seaweedfs.com.

readme.summary: Excellent quick start with three progressive setup options, but lacks configuration details and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section - missing common error scenarios, debugging steps, or FAQ for typical deployment issues

injection_risks.description: The targetReplica and targetTTL flags are not validated or sanitized before being used to update the super block. This could potentially lead to unexpected behavior if malicious input is provided.
The serversStr flag is not validated or sanitized before being used to establish a connection. This could potentially lead to unexpected behavior if malicious input is provided.

critical_findings: Unvalidated user input in change_superblock.go and diff_volume_servers.go
security.summary: The code has some potential security risks due to unvalidated user input, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows good practices.

common_complaints: Data loss risks from fsck operations with incomplete metadata collection
Remote mount and sync functionality issues with TTL and metadata persistence
Configuration errors in Kubernetes Helm charts
Authentication and security limitations for mounted access
praise_themes: Engagement on complex issues with discussion and follow-up
sentiment.summary: SeaweedFS shows moderate community health with active issue reporting on critical data integrity concerns, some recent responsiveness to bug reports, and a mix of long-standing feature requests alongside newer urgent issues.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are generally helpful, clear, and patient, providing a positive experience for users and contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being very recent (likely from automated sync)
674 open issues with no closed issues in past 6 months indicates unaddressed backlog
No merged PRs in past 6 months shows no active development or community contributions
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release infrastructure may be neglected
maintenance.summary: SeaweedFS appears abandoned with no development activity, PR merges, or issue resolution over the past 6 months despite a large backlog of unresolved issues.

project_metrics.description: SeaweedFS is a fast distributed storage system for blobs, objects, files, and data lake, for billions of files! Blob store has O(1) disk seek, cloud tiering. Filer supports Cloud Drive, xDC replication, Kubernetes, POSIX FUSE mount, S3 API, S3 Gateway, Hadoop, WebDAV, encryption, Erasure Coding. Enterprise version is at seaweedfs.com.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good introduction to SeaweedFS and its features, but lacks detailed configuration and troubleshooting documentation.
concerns: Community: compatibility problems with AWS services
Security: Unvalidated user input in change_superblock.go and diff_volume_servers.go
highlights: High number of commits in the past 6 months (790)
Recent last commit and release dates
Large number of merged PRs in the past 6 months (276)
Many contributors active in the past 6 months (61)
